alas_de_guitarra.about: All songs were performed by John Angelo Cardona in the month of May 2011, in Taganga (Santa Marta), Colombia. With a Latin American instrumental repertoire, the classical guitarist John Angelo makes his way in the silence, leaving us with a handful of all-time classics.

title.chunk_2: Music and Lyrics: Matto Rios - Facundo Rissotti

about.description: Chacabuco is the story of Claudia, a teenager who must return to live for a summer with her father Marcelo after fifteen years of living apart. The stay takes place in the house of her grandfather, who died recently. The arrival at the house of Pipo, Claudia's boyfriend and Sara, the grandfather's caretaker, will help to unite the central bond, interweaving it with a journey through the sexual awakening in adolescence, and a journey through memory, where the past plays a fundamental role in understanding and reconciling with the present.

title.chunk_1: Fragment of Original Music and Sound
title.chunk_2: for the documentary film EL ATENTADO

about.description: I live in the same house where my grandparents and my uncle Eduardo lived, who was in exile between 74 and 83. I met him at his return, and I strengthened our relationship with the philosophy classes he gave me at the 90s, when I was studying Art at Prilidiano Pueyrredón.  In spite of being a taciturn, intellectual and solid man, my uncle never talked about his role as an artist in the Argentine scene of 1968,  nor of his militancy in the ERP and his work known as The Attack, considered today as one of the most important of the political and conceptual art of its time. I found in a hiding place in this house a photograph that has become a document indispensable for understanding and witnessing those turbulent years. The documentary tells the story of Eduardo and his silence, of that work ephemeral but resounding that survived for decades in the evocation of other artists, from the house that for half a century hid a key document for the historiography of art.

about.title: Original music for the documentary film LA TIERRA QUE ARDE 🔥
about.description: In the summer of 2015, more than 50,000 hectares of Argentina's Andean-Patagonian forests were destroyed by the power of fire. What are the suspicions behind this real environmental catastrophe?

welcome.chunk_1: Since 2010 at Jacarandá Polvo we have been dedicated to music production for artists and projects on various platforms.
welcome.chunk_2: We compose, record and edit music for Cinema, TV and Theater. We make original audiovisual content.
welcome.chunk_3: If you have an idea or a project, do not hesitate to contact us.
